channel.title: How to tweet 101 spoiler: “Don’t tweet all about you: tweet all about them.”
channel.description:
https://www.dropbox.com/s/vv5u9t5d5gd113y/2016-01-04%2023.10.33%20chapito.jpg?dl=0 *Random pic, a view from [chapito](http://www.chapito.org/).*
A short guide to social media in general (even while focused on twitter) for newbies like me.
This is just my humble opinion main points summed up from [yet another great buffer post](https://blog.bufferapp.com/twitter-tips-for-beginners?utm_content=bufferd5efc&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer):
- A good bio sells. Be descriptive. Add: - accuracy. One professional description. - excitement. One word that is not boring. - target. One niche descriptor. - flattering. One accomplishment. - human element. Such as 01 hobby. - intrigue. One interesting fact or feature about yourself. - connection. Your company or another social profile.
- Respond to everyone. Engage.
- [Follow everyone. Spread the love.](/talk/t/when-is-10-not-enough-little-prince/7772)
- Once again, from the title: **Be social. Talk about everyone, not you**. And, by all means, do it from your point of view! ;P
